TopicTitle: I need YOU to help name a gigantic interplanetary station for my next cinematic.

Articles.Content:
If you have any names (More than one if you have them!) which I could use in my upcoming cinematic, I would love to hear them as inspiration.

[imgur][/imgur]

The station is going to Laythe on a 7 year mission. It will have a Von Braun wheel on it and it will be carrying supplies for at least 5 kerbals including a huge boat, mobile base, plane, and rovers.

With that information in mind, here's what I have so far:

- Sojourner Station

- Pioneer Station

- Spirit of Adventure

- Spirit of Kerbin

- Zephyr Station

- Explorer Station

- Zachariah of cosmos

- Aurora Station

- Laythe Venture

- Nova Station

- Hermes

- Apeiron Station

- Blue Tomorrow

- Quantum Sunrise

- KH-3000

- Intrepid Station

- Ambition

- Outreach

- Ranger

- Horizon

- Idyll

- Enigma

- Dyson Station

- Deep Space Wedgie

- Avera-9

- Ashley Madison

- Seven Year Itch

- Pride of Kerbin

- Bedlam

- Seven Years a Slave

- Rub' a dub dub, three Kerbs in ma tub

- Sterling/Stirling

- Kerbol/Solar Dawn

- Promiscuity

- Inexorable

- Superlative

- Joolia

- Rocks 'n' Frocks

- Mary Mary

- Archetypal

- Astraeus Astrological diety,Titan-god of dusk

- Thor's Revenge

- Tiberius Station

- Vitellius Station

- Pertinax Station Stubborn

- Macrinus Station

- Aurelian Station

- The Implication

- Per aspera ad astra "Through difficulty to the stars"

- Epsilon

etc...

Thanks for the help!

- Avera9eJoe

Edited September 14, 2015 by Avera9eJoe
Updated list
- Zachariah of cosmos

Hmm. I'm not great with station names. :/

Let's see...

  • Station Aurora
  • Laythe Venture
  • Nova Station
Hermes.
Thanks for the suggestions guys Added to the list.

Apeiron Station.

Yup.
I think Aurora Station sounds good! Saturn, Jupiter, or Kepler Station also sound good.

I have some good ones

  • Lazarus Station
  • Prometheus Forward Base
  • Avernus Station

Edited September 10, 2015 by Supernovas

Blue tomorrow?

Quantum Sunrise?

Forever dies tomorrow? Oh, wait that's a James Bond movie.

And, finally:

KH-3000 (Kerbal Holder)

I tend to have a list of names I re-use for various spacecraft, both stations, ships, satellites and launch vehicles. Here's a couple of my better ones:

- Intrepid

- Ambition

- Outreach

- Ranger

- Horizon

- Idyll

- Enigma

^ Majority of these are real words, feel free to look them up in a dictionary.
Dyson Station, after Freeman Dyson. He dreamed big.
I'm liking the name ambition. It's always good to name craft after common phrases or words and that word would fit the mission profile quite nicely.
Deep Space Wedgie!

I'm liking the name ambition. It's always good to name craft after common phrases or words and that word would fit the mission profile quite nicely.

Good to hear. I very much like those sort of names for spacecraft, especially since I watched Interstellar. "Endurance" is still a great ship name. Halo is good inspiration too: "Forward Unto Dawn" might be my very favourite ship name ever.

Oops, I'm starting to ramble...
You could name it Avera-9 and have it be a subtle reference to your forum name.

Here's a quick brain dump from me...

-Ashley Madison

-Seven Year Itch

-Pride of Kerbin

-Bedlam

-Seven Years a Slave

-Rub' a dub dub, three Kerbs in ma tub

-Sterling/Stirling

-Kerbol/Solar Dawn

-Promiscuity

-Inexorable

-Superlative

-Joolia

-Rocks 'n' Frocks

-Mary Mary

-Archetypal

-Astraeus

-Thor's Revenge

I should probably stop now.

(Some Roman names sound pretty official)

Tiberius Station

Vitellius Station

Pertinax Station

Macrinus Station

Aurelian Station

@FlipNascar lol! my vote's on Promiscuity.

thanks to Always Sunny, i also think The Implication makes a great boat/spaceship name.

-Rub' a dub dub, three Kerbs in ma tub

Made my day.

Ha! Some great names going up! You must have quite the mind to dump from flipnascar xD. Roman and Latin words are great to use too. My last ship had the name "Itineris" and the mission it flew was about 3 years after this one to Eeloo.

I'll update the list when I get home.

Edited September 12, 2015 by Avera9eJoe
Per aspera ad astra ("Through difficulty to the stars").

A few more...
